title: Caesar Cipher
description:
The Caesar cipher is one of the earliest known encryption techniques. It works by shifting each letter in the alphabet by a fixed number of positions. For example, with a shift of 3, 'A' becomes 'D', 'B' becomes 'E', and so on.

Your task: Decode the following encrypted message:

zhoogrqhwhdp

Hint: Try different shift values! The flag format is FLAG{decrypted_text}
hints: The shift might be a number between 1 and 25
Try shifting backwards through the alphabet
Count how many positions each letter has moved
